docs.title: OpenBosniana OS Installation Guide
docs.text: This guide will help you download the right ISO image, create your bootable media, and install OpenBosniana OS on your computer.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: • Install OpenBosniana OS Detailed instructions for installing OpenBosniana OS on your computer.

docs.title: Boot OpenBosniana OS
docs.text:
Now that you have OpenBosniana OS on a USB stick (or DVD), boot the computer from it.

  1. Insert your USB stick (or DVD) into the computer.

  2. Restart the computer.

  3. Before your computer boots your current operating system (Windows, Mac, Linux), you should see your BIOS loading screen. Check the screen or your computer's documentation to determine which key to press to instruct your computer to boot from USB (or DVD).

Note Most BIOS systems have a special key you can press to select the boot device, and all of them have a special key to enter the BIOS configuration screen (where you can define the boot order). Depending on the BIOS, these keys can be Escape, F1, F2, F8, F10, F11, F12, or Delete. This information is usually briefly displayed on the screen during the boot sequence.

Hint On Macs, keep your finger pressed on the Alt or Option key after hearing the boot sound.

  1. The OpenBosniana OS ISO can be booted in both EFI and BIOS modes:

    • In EFI mode, it displays a GRUB menu.
    • In BIOS mode, it displays an ISOLINUX menu.

  2. From one of these menus, press Enter to start OpenBosniana OS from your USB stick (or DVD).

docs.title: Create the Bootable Media
docs.text: The easiest way to install OpenBosniana OS is by using a USB stick. If your system does not support booting from USB, you can use a blank DVD instead.

docs.title: How to Make a Bootable USB Stick
docs.text:
To create a bootable USB stick, use Etcher, which works on OpenBosniana OS, Windows, macOS, and other Linux distributions.

  1. Download Etcher, install it, and run the application.

  2. Click Select image and choose your ISO file.

  3. Click Select drive and select your USB stick.
  4. Click Flash! to start creating the bootable USB stick.

docs.title: How to Make a Bootable DVD
docs.text:
Although optical discs are slower and more error-prone, you can still create a bootable DVD.

Note Burn the DVD at the lowest possible speed to prevent errors.

Warning Ensure you burn the content of the ISO, not the ISO file itself. After burning, your DVD should contain directories like boot, isolinux, and EFI. It should not contain just the .iso file.

docs.title: In Linux
docs.text: Install and use xfburn to burn the ISO to a DVD.

docs.title: In Windows
docs.text:
1. Right-click the ISO file and select Burn disk image.
  2. Enable the option Verify disc after burning to ensure there are no errors.

docs.title: In macOS
docs.text: 1. Right-click the ISO file and select Burn Disk Image to Disc.

docs.title: Choose the Right Edition
docs.text:
You can download OpenBosniana OS from the OpenBosniana OS website.

Read more about the available versions below.

docs.title: KDE Plasma, Xfce, or MATE?
docs.text:
OpenBosniana OS is available in three different versions, each featuring a unique desktop environment:

Desktop Environment Description KDE Plasma A modern, adaptable desktop environment with a beautiful, user-friendly interface. Xfce A stable and lightweight desktop environment. MATE An intuitive and attractive traditional desktop environment.

The main focus of OpenBosniana OS is the KDE Plasma edition.

The EDUCATION and HOME editions are available with the KDE Plasma desktop environment.

docs.title: Which Edition Should You Choose?
docs.text:
Although some editions offer more features and better support than others, while others are faster and consume fewer resources, all are excellent options. Choosing the right edition depends on your personal preferences.

Each desktop environment—KDE Plasma, Xfce, and MATE—offers its own menu system, panels, and configuration tools. They provide distinct experiences tailored to different user needs.

Tip: If you're unsure which desktop to pick, start with the KDE Plasma edition for a balanced, modern experience.

The best choice is the one that feels most comfortable—like home.

docs.title: The Live Session
docs.text:
When you boot the computer from the USB stick (or DVD), OpenBosniana OS starts a live session. It logs you in automatically as a user called user and shows you a desktop with the installer on it:

The live session is similar to a normal session (i.e., OpenBosniana OS once it is permanently installed on the computer), but with the following exceptions:

  • The live session is slower since it runs from a USB stick or DVD rather than an SSD or HDD.
  • Changes you make in the live session are not permanent. They are not written to the USB stick (or DVD) and do not impact the system installed later.
  • Some applications may behave differently in the live session.

Hint The username for the live session is user. The default password for both the live user and root is openbosniana.

docs.title: Installing OpenBosniana OS on Your Computer
1. Start the Installer
docs.text: Double-click Install OpenBosniana OS on the desktop.

docs.title: 2. Select Your Language
docs.text: Choose the language for the installation.

docs.title: 3. Select Your Location
docs.text:
The next screen displays a map where you can choose your location. This will set your time zone and download server.

  • Use the Region drop-down menu to select your region.
  • Use the Zone field to choose a major city in the same time zone.
  • Customize the system language and regional formats by using the Change buttons.

docs.title: 4. Select Keyboard Layout
docs.text: Choose your keyboard layout and verify it by typing in the provided text box.

docs.title: 5. Set Up Partitions
docs.text:
Decide how to allocate disk space:

  • Erase Disk: Formats the entire disk (all data will be deleted).
  • Install Alongside Another OS: Automatically resizes the existing OS and installs OpenBosniana OS beside it.
  • Something Else: Manually manage partitions.

Note OpenBosniana OS requires a partition mounted on the root / directory. It's recommended to create a swap partition for hibernation and additional memory support.

docs.title: 6. Configure User Settings
docs.text:
Set up your user account:

  • Enter your name, username, computer name, and password.
  • Verify the details with a green checkmark before proceeding.

docs.title: 7. Review and Confirm
docs.text: Review the summary of your installation settings. If everything is correct, press Install. A confirmation dialog will appear to begin the installation process.

docs.title: 8. Installation Progress
docs.text: The installer shows progress with a bar and percentage. Additional details can be viewed by clicking the Magnifying Glass button. A slideshow will play during installation.

docs.title: Rebooting Into the Installed System
docs.text:
Once installation is complete:

  1. Choose to reboot by selecting the Reboot now checkbox.
  2. Remove the installation media when prompted.
  3. Press Done to restart your computer into the newly installed OpenBosniana OS.

If you want to continue using the live session, uncheck Reboot now and press Done to close the installer.

docs.title: Verify Your ISO Image
docs.text:
Verifying the integrity and authenticity of your ISO image is crucial to ensure a smooth installation process.

  • Integrity verification ensures the ISO image was downloaded correctly and matches the original file available on the server. This prevents issues caused by corrupted files.
  • Authenticity verification confirms the ISO image is signed by OpenBosniana OS, ensuring it has not been tampered with or replaced by a malicious copy.

docs.title: Download the SHA256 and MD5 Sums
docs.text:
Download the file openbosniana.sha256sum from the same location where you downloaded the ISO image.

Important Do not modify the downloaded checksum file.

docs.title: Verify the Integrity of the ISO File
docs.text:
To verify the integrity of the ISO file, generate its SHA256 hash and compare it to the hash provided in openbosniana.sha256sum.

Run the following command in your terminal:

```bash sha256sum -b OpenBosniana---*_amd64.iso
